I was worried this would interfere with my ability to build a good town, but it hasn't caused any problems. This game involves a lot of repetitive actions, so if that doesn't appeal to you then this isn't the game for you. When deciding to buy this game, I debated between getting it and Tomodachi Life. I later purchased Tomodachi Life as well, and can say that I much prefer Animal Crossing: New Leaf. It's a lot more fun being able to control your own character and shape your own town, rather than just giving gifts to tiny people. Animal  Crossing: New Leaf is a great game and I very much recommend it.

It's a pretty addictive little game for playing 30~ minutes a day (or longer if you're bug or fish hunting!).There's also a lot of improvements over the other games. Way more unlockables, no need waiting a day to get fossil results, tons of buildings and landscaping, and downloadable designs from QR codes!If you like games with lots of collectables, cute stuff, styles, and characters, it's definitely worth picking up. Some of the characters I found myself rolling my eyes at so frequently I had to turn the game off. I can completely see this game being amazing for people who've found themselves drawn toward JRPGs, but it simply doesn't compare (IMO) to other RPGs (Final Fantasy, Chronotrigger, etc.) I'm really disappointed in Vita's selection of games, especially if this is the most popular.

review_text: Worth all the hype and more, Theres a reason its  the highest rated vita game of all time as well as one of the highest rated rpgs of all time. The 100 plus hours of dungeon crawling and characterization is almost unmatched.

Persona 4 perfects on the anime themed high school sim / dungeon crawling formula most notably laid down in Persona 3. Where Persona 4 succeeds is in presenting a murder mystery with a whole lotta heart and an infectious upbeat feeling that makes the highs high and the lows low. It's hard not to feel for the various characters as you become intimate with their hopes, dreams and darkest secrets. Persona 4 asks if you can face your inner demons at one moment then presents a heart wrenching dilemma between hanging out with your friends or going out for ramen.You'll easily lose yourself in 100+ hours of solid JRPG complete with a bonus dungeon, some new endings and easily the most wholesome entry in the Persona series to date.

review_title: Compared to the original it has more content and better graphics. You get 2 additional social links
review_text: Persona 4 Golden is one of those games that is so hard to explain to people other than just saying "play it and you'll understand".I am (now) a big fan of the Persona series and P4G has a very special place in my heart. Compared to the original it has more content and better graphics. You get 2 additional social links, another month of gameplay and an additional epilogue. I'm sure there's more than I'm missing as well.This is a top-tier JRPG with a rich story and a wonderful group of characters. The character development through the social links gives you an in-depth understanding of everyone's true feelings regarding themselves and you as the protagonist.Thanks to P4G we also have 2 fun and hilarious spin-off games that are also well worth your time and money. I'd also suggest watching the original anime (not Golden anime) to immerse yourself further in the story.I really cannot begin to describe my love for Persona 4 but I can tell you it is everything a JRPG lover wants and more.

Coming off the exciting adventure of Persona 5, I decided to pick up this title, Persona 4 Golden. Its one of the best rpgs, and for a reason. most RPGs with turn-based combat are often tedious due to how they always require the player to use the same tactics and redundantly engage in encounters, often out of their ability to predict, Persona 4 Golden however, allows your combat to evolve, and gives breathers with its visual novel identity, having a social system with great characters that are timeless and loveable. It does familiars better than pokemon ever did, having a compendium and the ability to customize your personas much more. The combat can get a bit repetitive, even with breaks, but they are still enjoyable. The story is great, having a mystery element that makes the player think. Its just a great game, play it. I don't think the game is as good as Persona 5 due to the lesser immersion, style, lore, and combat depth, but its still an amazing game.

review_title: because I have a lot of love for the original P4 game
review_text: I went through the effort of getting a PS Vita almost solely for the sake of playing this game, because I have a lot of love for the original P4 game, and for P3P before it, and I've got to say it was absolutely worth it. This game comes with LOADS more content, not just in terms of the extra months of gameplay you get at the end, but all the new characters, features, and mini cutscenes you get right from the beginning! If you like P4, this game is absolutely worth buying for the extra content, even if you've played through P4 before, as I have.
